name: foliation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a process in which rocks divide into thin layers that can be separated, or the layers themselves: Pressure concentrated in opposing directions often causes foliation in rocks. The presence of foliation is a clue to metamorphic rocks. See
foliated
More examplesFewer examplesThe resulting foliation is coarser and more distinct than that of slate.Rock foliations and lineations are indistinct or lacking.Commonly a lineation lies in the plane of a foliation in the same rock. Regional metamorphism frequently causes foliation.
